summary: This is a protective order issued by Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The order establishes strict rules governing the handling, use, and disclosure of sensitive discovery materials produced by the government, including confidential witness/victim information and highly confidential materials containing sexualized images.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which this protective order is issued. The order restricts her and her defense team's access to and use of discovery materials.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this protective order.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judicial officer over the criminal case in which Maxwell is the defendant.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issues a protective order in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) to govern the handling of sensitive discovery materials.

keyFacts: The government's discovery materials include 'Highly Confidential Information' defined as containing 'nude, partially-nude, or otherwise sexualized images, videos, or other depictions of individuals.'
The protective order aims to protect the privacy of victims and witnesses, prevent prejudicial pretrial publicity, and safeguard the government's ongoing investigation.
Ghislaine Maxwell is only allowed to review certain sensitive discovery materials in the presence of her defense counsel or through a secured electronic system provided by the Bureau of Prisons.

The order establishes a tiered system for discovery materials: general Discovery, Confidential Information (containing personal identification info), and Highly Confidential Information (containing sexualized imagery).
